Invitation should contain full surname and name(s) of the inviting person, details of his/her passport and temporary or permanent residency permit (for a foreigner/stateless person), address, and full name of the invited person, information about his/her date and place of birth, nationality, passport details, place of residence, purpose of visit, duration of intended visit to Ukraine, number of entries and place of stay in Ukraine, inviting person’s obligations to cover costs related to the applicant’s stay and/or departure from Ukraine. Copies of the inviting person’s Ukrainian passport (if an inviting person is Ukraine’s national) or Copies of the inviting person’s passport – of natural person and permit for permanent or temporary residence in Ukraine (for foreigners or stateless persons) should be provided as well;This is what it says Aww bb!! He is our greatest living chronicler of the natural world yet was never formally trained in the sciences… As he follows scientists into thickets, real and rhetorical, he keeps an eye not only on the rigor demanded by science, but on the wonder and play and curiosity — the noodling — of serious creativity. These are the very qualities that infuse and leaven his own work, making unlikely page-turners out of burly books on zoonotic diseases and biogeography. Nonfiction ought to be “artful, imaginative, accurate,” Quammen has written. “This combination of adjectives is not contradictory.” - Parul Sehgal’s review of David Quammen’s new book in the NYTimes.That's where it came from pretty randomOh wow That’s actually so deepIi knowwww I knowww it's in our intern handbookThey should advertise it more so people take it more seriouslyyeah I know haha but their target customer is not the public it's the universities so it doesn't really matter for now that's actually something we are trying to fix as a cohort the public facing image of NoodleOh yeah, that’s true NoodleYupI’m really hungry hahaYummy? hahahha I will make food for you!! I'm reviewing your resume now and here are my initial thoughts: First, I really like how you quantified a lot of your achievements, that's really good, recruiters like that. The part where you say "reduced budget redundancies by 17%" sounds really cool haha but idk it feels little arbitrary. For Equbot, I think you should say how you worked in a team (you did, right?) or even better, say how you led the team to success. Perhaps you can say something like "Coordinated a team of 4 and designed a neural network framework to analyze stock market data and predict daily returns" - to show that you are a good teamplayer Also, you are part of the Finance MiCo, right? Add that under Minerva, and maybe get rid of the "7 cities across the globe" part - cause I'm not sure how impressive that makes your resume seem. For me to apply for the Ukrainian short-term visa (Type-C), I will need this: ”Notarized letter of invitation from a physical person – Ukrainian citizen, foreigner or stateless person who legally reside, temporarily or permanently, in Ukraine. Invitation shall contain full name of a physical person, details of his/her passport and temporary or permanent residency permit (for a foreigner or stateless person), address, and full name of the invited person, information about his/her date and place of birth, nationality, passport details, place of residence, purpose of visit, duration of intended visit to Ukraine, number of entries and place of stay in Ukraine, physical person’s obligations towards possible costs related to the invited person’s stay or departure from Ukraine. The invitation shall be appended by copies of a hosting person’s passport and temporary or permanent residency permit in Ukraine (for a foreigner or stateless person).” And apparently you gotta go to a notary and ask them to give you a letter like this? Then you just gotta sign it and scan it and send it to me so I can print it and bring it to the embassy. Also bb, please do it before the 1st of July cause the Ukrainian consulate needs 10 business days to process it and I’ll need my passport to apply for German visa afterwards. Good news though, the consulate is super close to my house (18 min walk) so I’ll be able to apply easier hehe Please let me know if you/your parents know how to do this ️ [[Video, size 2'477'638 bytes]] [[Video, size 2'508'010 bytes]] [[Video, size 1'654'588 bytes]] [[Video, size 2'501'517 bytes]] [[Video, size 2'493'180 bytes]] [[Video, size 2'533'487 bytes]]Sorry for my weird hair bb  I’m sleeping soon and I don’t wanna put gel in my hair haha Also, can you send me a picture of you doing this Okay bb! I was doing some thinking and I realized how childish and stupid I was to delete the story just because you wasn’t reposting it. I should’ve been more matured about this, and understand that we don’t really have to keep posting pictures on social media. It is one thing to be open about our relationship on Instagram, but it’s another thing to post excessively in a desperate attempt to show people how happy we are together, or to get that sense of validation when people reply “YOU GUYS ARE SO CUTE” to my story with you. I feel like I’m beginning to fall deep into that rabbit hole of social media validation, and I think it is super unhealthy, and in this sense, I really need to learn from you - you are not the kind of person who posts a lot on social media, and whenever you do, it’s not to gain attention, and I actually respect you a lot because of that. Thank you for making me realize how superficial all these social media interactions are - I promise not to be so childish in the future. I’m sorry if what I did today made the mood awkward between us. I hope that we’ll be able to clear the air tomorrow - after all, you and I are like buttcheeks; despite all the shit that came between us, we’ll always get back together no matter what. You are trying to convince a committee to purchase a license for your new app. You make your presentation, and move on to Q&A. You notice that when one of the women speaks, everyone else keeps quiet—and she’s never contradicted. Making a quick decision, you choose to focus on what she’s concerned about even though it’s not the main “weak” point of your presentation. After some back-and-forth, she says that you have good answers and she’s pleased with the app. The other members continue asking questions, but whenever you are having a hard time answering she makes a helpful comment. Within a few minutes, the group agrees to support your project.Recognize how to influence group interactions by exerting different types of power. (H) CS Groups quickly develop their own dynamics, which include differences in degrees and kinds of influence that individual members exert. Understanding different approaches to influencing others allows one to apply them strategically.yupppYou are working in a laboratory in Korea and you are unsure how to best interact with your supervising professor. You observe your colleagues and realize that it is very different from how they interact with each other. Because of his position, there is a clear adaptation of behavior in terms of body language (they bow respectfully and keep their hands folded in front of them), but also in terms of how they propose new ideas. They only put forward ideas as if they were humble suggestions that they are looking for feedback on, so as not to imply their ideas are better than or at the level of their higher-up. You read about how hierarchical Korean culture is and understand where these power dynamics come from: younger individuals should always respect their elders, especially in a professional environment. Power is also strongly associated with position in the formal hierarchy of the organization. You also realize Korean culture is quite indirect, and therefore forwardly proposing ideas would sound confrontational and challenging to the existing power structures. You decide to do the same and respect these power dynamics, so you can contribute without being too confrontational. [Footnote: Explains where the power dynamics arise from (Korean culture) and how they shape group behavior, expanding upon how these specific dynamics were used to guide professional interactions in the situation.]oooohhh who wrote thisThat's an example on the platform for this HCohhh I have a different example so weird ok I guess I'll change it wait4 grade: Explains the origins of power dynamics in context; explains how power differentials shape individual and group behavior in context; (when relevant) analyzes a sophisticated and non-standard example of power dynamics; (when relevant) uses an in-depth analysis of power dynamics to guide interactions within a group context or critique a proposed approach to interactions.yup, I see that haha[[Photo]] Not sure what was it about because I cannot load my assignmentMy baby got a 4But I think you should change your paragraph a little bithmmm okay I think I get it I will thanks bb!!!I didn't do anything layou did la you showed me the lightI didn't la Actually you proved to me that I am not ready for Minerva haha My brain doesn't work for these HCshmm tbh you don't need HCs just focus on your LOs HCs will only be important during capstoneTo be honest, the same thing Main conclusion: I don't know what's going on Tomorrow you'll have a very exciting day indeed So many reunions Friends!! Like yesterday, when I was going to bed, you said that you are stupid, you compared yourself to Gadi, mentioned all the wonderful knowledge that other people have, but you failed to recognize one person who is also so smart, so talented, who has the ability to study and achieve so much. And that one person is you, Steven. I won't lie to you, there will always be a person who is smarter than you, me, Gadi, your professors, even your parents. And guess what? It's okay!! As long as you are tracking your own growth and you see the changes, you are living a healthy life. Why the heck would you compare yourself to others? We all have different backgrounds, priorities, memories, mental issues, abilities. We are all so different. I know at Minerva it's hard to be "blind" to other people's knowledge. You think I always feel great in this community? Oh God no. I try to look at this from a different perspective - I try to learn from people who are smarter than me. I wouldn't want to be the smartest because then I wouldn't learn anything in this environment. Only with this competition we are trying to be better BUT there's a healthy balance to it. You don't have to die just because you want to be recognized by the professors, or be better than that girl in your CS class. After graduation, everything you'll have left will be just your own knowledge that you'll have to use to open new doors, and guess what? There will be always people who will be more qualified for those "new doors", people who will have more experiences, who will be older than you, who in the past simply were more lucky regarding opportunities, and guess what? It's okay!!! As long as you do your best, life will reward you. Whenever you fail, take it as a lesson, experience that made you stronger, learn something from it. Life will be tough in terms of knowledge, competition, and working environments, but there are so many other problems, like health that are far more important, and if you think about it, is it really worth putting your health, your mental health into trouble just because someone is smarter? Talking about the classes, if it makes you feel better (that someone is more stupid than you), today I messed up the poll, like my answer was okay but then at the end Anzhelika was stupid enough to write that R&D, and net profit ratio can be derived from the balance sheet. GOD I KNOW ITS INCOME STATEMENT, but I just understood the question incorrectly. Now I know for the rest of my life these concepts because once I failed, I learned from it. Other people might have gotten it right, and I am happy for them. The same needs to be taught to you. Every answer that you give in your class can include as many mistakes as you want, just make sure you know the material, you gain the knowledge. In the end, your classes are over, and all that matters is how you apply your knowledge in the real world. Should I mention your successful internship at Noodle?
